intro: Tricoryne elatior var. typica, commonly known as the common tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in dry meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils. Tricoryne elatior var. typica is known for its aromatic foliage and has been historically used in traditional medicine.
